result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:18 PM Defendant DANIELLE M HINZ appeared by video.  Attorney Walter Arthur Piel Jr. appeared by video for DANIELLE M HINZ.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2022CF30, 22TR155 and 22TR158. Court is also appearing via remotely. Atty Piel has received an offer and is declining the offer at this time and requests this case be set for trial. Court sets for Jury Trial on January 31, 2023. ADA to check with the analyst and confirm date or if a conflict what may work that week, as a backup 01/30 or 02/03. Court sets for final pretrial conference on December 13, 2022 at 3:30 PM via zoom. Both parties to file MIL, PJI, witness lists and any motions by the end of the day December 6, 2022.

Court adjourned at 2:29 PM
Status hearing on September 27, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

3:01 PM Defendant DANIELLE M HINZ appeared by video.  Attorney Walter Arthur Piel Jr. appeared by video for DANIELLE M HINZ.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court also calls 2022TR155 & 2022TR158 which are tracking with the criminal case. Statement by Atty Piel - matters are not resolved at this time. Statement by ADA McElroy - an offer was sent to Atty Piel and different  resolutions were discussed. Statement by Atty Piel, has not seen the offer from friday and would like to discuss with the defendant and requests another status hearing. Court sets for Status Hearing on September 27, 2022 at 2:15 PM via zoom.

Court adjourned at 3:04 PM
Status hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Status hearing on August 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:57 PM Defendant DANIELLE M HINZ appeared by video.  Attorney Walter Arthur Piel Jr. appeared by video for DANIELLE M HINZ.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2022CF30, 2022TR155 & 2022TR158. Atty Peil states he has received a Discovery invoice which he paid but has not received the Discovery and has received an offer and requests more time. ADA confirms the check has been received for the Discovery and Discovery will be sent. Court sets for Status Hearing on August 23, 2022 at 3:00 PM via zoom.

Court adjourned at 3:00 PM

records.addlTxt:
3:32 PM Defendant DANIELLE M HINZ in court.  Attorney Walter Arthur Piel Jr. in court for DANIELLE M HINZ.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. 22TR155 & 22TR158 are tracking. Atty Piel states the prelim will proceed.

Taylor Wallace sworn, direct by ADA McElroy, is employed by the Green Lake County Sheriff's Office as a Sheriff's Deputy. Goes over the date in question. Testimony given. Atty Piel stipulates to identification of the defendant. Objection by Atty Piel. Statement by ADA Mcelroy. ADA Mcelroy continues with direct examination. Venue established. Cross exam by Atty Piel. Argument by ADA Mcelroy. Argument by Atty Piel. 

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy to Atty Piel. Attorney Piel and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Piel enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court goes over the costs and penalties. Atty Piel requests a Status Hearing be scheduled. Court will set for July 19, 2022 at 3:00 PM via zoom. 

Court adjourned at 3:48 PM
Status hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status hearing on July 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:16 PM Defendant DANIELLE M HINZ appeared by video.  Attorney Walter Arthur Piel Jr. appeared by video for DANIELLE M HINZ.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 2022CF30 and notes 2022TR155 & 2022TR158 are tracking. Court is appearing remotely from Marquette County. Statement by Atty Piel, is waiting on the blood results that were just received. Statement by ADA McElroy. Atty Piel states that a preliminary hearing can be scheduled. Court sets for Preliminary Hearing on June 14, 2022 at 3:30 PM in-person. Statement by ADA McElroy, will file an amended complaint.

Court adjourned at 1:20 PM

2:25 PM Defendant DANIELLE M HINZ appeared by video.  Attorney Walter Arthur Piel Jr. appeared by video for DANIELLE M HINZ.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court appeared by video from Marquette County. Clerk appeared by video. Court calls 22CF30, 22TR155 and 21TR158. Def and attorney have no objection to appearing by zoom. Def's microphone is not working. Defendant and attorney have no objection for the attorney speaking on the defendant's behalf. Atty Piel confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court enters NOT GUILTY PLEAS for the traffic cases on behalf of the defendant and will track them with this case. Court notes bond has been set. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. ADA McElroy states the blood results are not back at this point. Court will set for Status Hearing May 17, 2022 at 1:15 PM, all parties to appear by zoom.

Court adjourned at 2:29 PM.
Status hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status hearing on May 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm. / Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (all parties)
Initial appearance on April 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
(Judge Chad Hendee)

Defendant Danielle M. Hinz appeared in custody, by video, Attorney Matthew McElroy appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court has received the probable cause statement. ADA McElroy goes over the defendant's criminal history. ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation.
